articles.headline: Thousands of Boko Haram Members Surrendered. They Moved In Next Door.
articles.snippet: Fighters and family members of a terrorist group in Nigeria have defected in droves since the death of their leader. They’ve been relocated to a city they once terrorized.
articles.abstract: Fighters and family members of a terrorist group in Nigeria have defected in droves since the death of their leader. They’ve been relocated to a city they once terrorized.
articles.lead_paragraph: MAIDUGURI, Nigeria — For over a decade, the extremist group Boko Haram has terrorized northeastern Nigeria — killing tens of thousands of people, kidnapping schoolgirls and sending suicide bombers into busy marketplaces.
articles.byline: By Ruth Maclean and Ismail Alfa

articles.headline: As Debt Default Looms, Yellen Faces Her Biggest Test Yet
articles.snippet: The Treasury secretary must wade into a standoff between Democrats and Republicans over raising the debt limit.
articles.abstract: The Treasury secretary must wade into a standoff between Democrats and Republicans over raising the debt limit.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — When Janet L. Yellen was Federal Reserve chair in 2014, she faced a grilling from Republicans about whether the federal government had a plan if the nation’s borrowing limit was breached and measures to keep paying the country’s bills were exhausted.

articles.headline: Thousands of Haitians Allowed to Stay in U.S. as Texas Camp Clears Out
articles.snippet: Border agents are making life-altering decisions for thousands of Haitian families on the border on whether they can stay in the U.S. or be deported.
articles.abstract: Border agents are making life-altering decisions for thousands of Haitian families on the border on whether they can stay in the U.S. or be deported.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN ANTONIO — In Houston, nearly 2,000 Haitian migrants have arrived this week from the small border community of Del Rio, with buses pulling up to a huge shelter nearly every hour. In San Antonio, hundreds more have been allowed by the U.S. authorities onto flights to destinations as far away as New York, Boston and Miami, paperwork in their pockets permitting them to remain in the country.
articles.byline: By Edgar Sandoval, Simon Romero and Miriam Jordan

articles.headline: Republican Review of Arizona Vote Fails to Show Stolen Election
articles.snippet: The criticized review showed much the same results as in November, with 99 more Biden votes and 261 fewer Trump ones.
articles.abstract: The criticized review showed much the same results as in November, with 99 more Biden votes and 261 fewer Trump ones.
articles.lead_paragraph: PHOENIX — After months of delays and blistering criticism, a review of the 2020 election in Arizona’s largest county, ordered up and financed by Republicans, has failed to show that former President Donald J. Trump was cheated of victory.
articles.byline: By Jack Healy, Michael Wines and Nick Corasaniti

articles.headline: An Insider Details the ‘Black Box’ of Money and Power in China
articles.snippet: A memoir by a well-connected businessman offers insights into the Communist Party’s thinking as it tightens its grip on the private sector.
articles.abstract: A memoir by a well-connected businessman offers insights into the Communist Party’s thinking as it tightens its grip on the private sector.
articles.lead_paragraph: To build a logistics hub next to Beijing’s main airport, Desmond Shum spent three years collecting 150 official seals from the many-layered Chinese bureaucracy.

articles.headline: China Cracks Down Harder on Cryptocurrency With New Ban
articles.snippet: The clampdown comes as China’s central bank has been testing its own digital currency. The price of Bitcoin dropped on the news.
articles.abstract: The clampdown comes as China’s central bank has been testing its own digital currency. The price of Bitcoin dropped on the news.
articles.lead_paragraph: China intensified its crackdown on cryptocurrency on Friday, declaring all financial transactions involving cryptocurrencies illegal and issuing a nationwide ban on cryptocurrency mining, the power-hungry process in which vast computer networks compete for newly created crypto tokens.
articles.byline: By Amy Qin and Ephrat Livni

articles.headline: China Detains Business Chiefs as Its Corporate Crusade Expands
articles.snippet: The seizure of the top two leaders of HNA Group comes as speculation swirls over whether Beijing will bail out another troubled giant, Evergrande.
articles.abstract: The seizure of the top two leaders of HNA Group comes as speculation swirls over whether Beijing will bail out another troubled giant, Evergrande.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — China has kicked up its campaign to tame its free-spending, debt-laden companies, as the authorities punished the corporate chiefs of two troubled companies while letting a troubled property giant continue to struggle under the weight of more than $300 billion in debt.

articles.headline: In Race for 5G, Alarm and Security Services Get Stuck in the Middle
articles.snippet: Covid-19 shutdowns and chip shortages have made it more difficult to upgrade devices and meet a deadline set by AT&T.
articles.abstract: Covid-19 shutdowns and chip shortages have made it more difficult to upgrade devices and meet a deadline set by AT&T.
articles.lead_paragraph: Melissa Brinkman’s troubles are threatening to slow down AT&T’s multibillion-dollar rollout of ultrafast 5G wireless technology.

articles.headline: Could This Covid Wave Reverse the Recovery? Here’s What to Watch.
articles.snippet: Some businesses are still hurting, and federal aid has wound down. But economists see sources of resilience and signs of strength.
articles.abstract: Some businesses are still hurting, and federal aid has wound down. But economists see sources of resilience and signs of strength.
articles.lead_paragraph: The spread of the Delta variant has delayed office reopenings, disrupted the start of school and generally dashed hopes for a return to normal after Labor Day. But it has not pushed the U.S. economic recovery into reverse.
